issue.title: Reconnecting client on FreeBSD fails with "bad file descriptor" error
issue.body:
Hi,

On FreeBSD 11.2 only I'm having a strange problem:

1. server is up
2. client starts&connects
3. client disconnects&stops
4. client strarts and tries connection again. This fails with error `bad file descriptor` (serverside error).


When clients reconnects, server assings same `*nbio.Conn.Hash()` value(which is a closed `*Conn`) and that causes problem.

After restarting server client can connect succesffully.

comment.body:
Perfect, thank you very much.

- FreeBSD - reconnection problem is resolved(unix, UDP, TCP all OK).
- macOS - MaxOpenFiles setting problme is resolved.

have a nice day, you can close this issue, thanks again.

issue.title: Reconnecting client on FreeBSD fails with "bad file descriptor" error
issue.body:
Hi,

On FreeBSD 11.2 only I'm having a strange problem:

1. server is up
2. client starts&connects
3. client disconnects&stops
4. client strarts and tries connection again. This fails with error `bad file descriptor` (serverside error).


When clients reconnects, server assings same `*nbio.Conn.Hash()` value(which is a closed `*Conn`) and that causes problem.

After restarting server client can connect succesffully.

comment.body:
FYI, if I switch to `TCP` same problem happens as for unix domain socket (SOCK_STREAM?):

```
$ ./server
2022/11/02 19:51:33.634 [INF] NBIO[NB] start listen on: ["tcp@localhost:9999"]
2022/11/02 19:51:39.691 [INF] client 12 connected
2022/11/02 19:51:39.847 [WRN] client 12 disconnected, err: <nil>
2022/11/02 19:51:42.472 [INF] client 12 connected
2022/11/02 19:51:42.473 [WRN] client 12 disconnected, err: bad file descriptor
```

----

```
$ ./client
2022/11/02 19:51:39.679 [INF] NBIO[NB] start
2022/11/02 19:51:39.846 [INF] success
2022/11/02 19:51:40.069 [INF] NBIO[NB] stop

$ ./client
2022/11/02 19:51:42.467 [INF] NBIO[NB] start
2022/11/02 19:52:42.337 [ERR] timeout
2022/11/02 19:52:42.559 [INF] NBIO[NB] stop
```

If I switch to "UDP",  reconnection works without a problem(derived client example from [here](https://github.com/lesismal/nbio-examples/blob/master/udp/client/client.go) 

```
$ ./server
2022/11/02 20:12:59.284 [INF] NBIO[NB] start listen on: ["udp@localhost:8888"]
2022/11/02 20:13:01.982 [INF] client 11 connected 127.0.0.1:64700
2022/11/02 20:13:02.995 [WRN] client 11 disconnected, 127.0.0.1:64700, err: read timeout
2022/11/02 20:13:03.274 [INF] client 11 connected 127.0.0.1:33617
2022/11/02 20:13:04.280 [WRN] client 11 disconnected, 127.0.0.1:33617, err: read timeout
```
---
```
$ ./client
2022/11/02 20:13:01.980 [INF] connecting to udp@127.0.0.1:8888
2022/11/02 20:13:01.981 [INF] NBIO[NB] start
2022/11/02 20:13:01.982 [INF] onData hello
2022/11/02 20:13:01.983 [INF] success
2022/11/02 20:13:02.189 [INF] NBIO[NB] stop

 ./client
2022/11/02 20:13:03.273 [INF] connecting to udp@127.0.0.1:8888
2022/11/02 20:13:03.273 [INF] NBIO[NB] start
2022/11/02 20:13:03.274 [INF] onData hello
2022/11/02 20:13:03.275 [INF] success
2022/11/02 20:13:03.485 [INF] NBIO[NB] stop
```

issue.title: Reconnecting client on FreeBSD fails with "bad file descriptor" error
issue.body:
Hi,

On FreeBSD 11.2 only I'm having a strange problem:

1. server is up
2. client starts&connects
3. client disconnects&stops
4. client strarts and tries connection again. This fails with error `bad file descriptor` (serverside error).


When clients reconnects, server assings same `*nbio.Conn.Hash()` value(which is a closed `*Conn`) and that causes problem.

After restarting server client can connect succesffully.

comment.body:
ISOs are at [here](http://ftp-archive.freebsd.org/pub/FreeBSD-Archive/old-releases/ISO-IMAGES/11.2/)

Also I checked for **FreeBSD 12.2**, same problem(except client waited timeout for a minute):

Server:

```
$ ./server
2022/11/02 19:07:28.609 [INF] NBIO[NB] start listen on: ["unix@/tmp/nbio.sock"]
2022/11/02 19:07:32.145 [INF] client 12 connected
2022/11/02 19:07:32.500 [WRN] client 12 disconnected, err: <nil>
2022/11/02 19:07:34.667 [INF] client 12 connected
2022/11/02 19:07:34.667 [WRN] client 12 disconnected, err: bad file descriptor
```

Client:

```
$ ./client
2022/11/02 19:07:34.666 [INF] NBIO[NB] start
2022/11/02 19:08:34.553 [ERR] timeout
2022/11/02 19:08:34.769 [INF] NBIO[NB] stop
```

issue.title: Postgresql 15 Installlation
issue.body:
Hi, as commented on README, running 

```bash
curl https://techsupport.enterprisedb.com/api/repository/dl/default/release/15/rpm | bash
```

fails with:

```
Error: unknown PostgreSQL version '15'.
```

issue.title: a2.hasNationalNumber is not a function.
issue.body:
I am using the library as 
```js
import { PhoneNumberUtil } from 'google-libphonenumber';
console.log("The possible number is" ,PhoneNumberUtil.getInstance().isPossibleNumber("+5511951374816"))
```
It is giving the error.

```
libphonenumber.js:953 Uncaught TypeError: a2.hasNationalNumber is not a function
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.getNationalSignificantNumber (libphonenumber.js:953:92)
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.isPossibleNumberForTypeWithReason (libphonenumber.js:984:104)
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.isPossibleNumberWithReason (libphonenumber.js:983:96)
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.isPossibleNumber (libphonenumber.js:978:81)
    at eventPage.js:9:69
```
The library version is 
```    "google-libphonenumber": "^3.2.30"```

comment.body:
As informed on [README.md](https://github.com/ruimarinho/google-libphonenumber/blob/master/README.md#usage), you should parse string phone value with `phoneUtil.parseAndKeepRawInput` as:

```js
console.log("The possible number is" , PhoneNumberUtil.getInstance().isPossibleNumber(phoneUtil.parseAndKeepRawInput('202-456-1414', 'US')))
```

When clients reconnects, server assings same `*nbio.Conn.Hash()` value(which is a closed `*Conn`) and that causes problem.

After restarting server client can connect succesffully.

comment.body:
Perfect, thank you very much.

- FreeBSD - reconnection problem is resolved(unix, UDP, TCP all OK).
- macOS - MaxOpenFiles setting problme is resolved.

have a nice day, you can close this issue, thanks again.

issue.title: a2.hasNationalNumber is not a function.
issue.body:
I am using the library as 
```js
import { PhoneNumberUtil } from 'google-libphonenumber';
console.log("The possible number is" ,PhoneNumberUtil.getInstance().isPossibleNumber("+5511951374816"))
```
It is giving the error.

```
libphonenumber.js:953 Uncaught TypeError: a2.hasNationalNumber is not a function
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.getNationalSignificantNumber (libphonenumber.js:953:92)
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.isPossibleNumberForTypeWithReason (libphonenumber.js:984:104)
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.isPossibleNumberWithReason (libphonenumber.js:983:96)
    at i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil.isPossibleNumber (libphonenumber.js:978:81)
    at eventPage.js:9:69
```
The library version is 
```    "google-libphonenumber": "^3.2.30"```

comment.body:
As informed on [README.md](https://github.com/ruimarinho/google-libphonenumber/blob/master/README.md#usage), you should parse string phone value with `phoneUtil.parseAndKeepRawInput` as:

```js
console.log("The possible number is" , PhoneNumberUtil.getInstance().isPossibleNumber(phoneUtil.parseAndKeepRawInput('202-456-1414', 'US')))
```
